meanings.definition: A person or thing that wabbles.
meanings.sent1: The wabblers in the park were ducks waddling around.
meanings.sent2: The children laughed at the wabblers on the playground.
meanings.sent3: The wabblers in the zoo were the most entertaining animals to watch.
meanings.sent4: The wabblers in the forest moved with a comical waddle.
meanings.sent5: The wabblers in the pond were a delightful sight to see.

meanings.definition: To move unsteadily from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The boat wabblers in the rough sea made everyone feel queasy.
meanings.sent2: The drunk man wabblers down the street, struggling to keep his balance.
meanings.sent3: The toddler wabblers across the room, trying to reach his toy.
meanings.sent4: The leaves wabblers in the wind, dancing back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge wabblers under the weight of the heavy truck.

meanings.definition: To talk in a rambling, foolish, or meaningless way.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa wabblers on about the good old days when he was young.
meanings.sent2: The politician wabblers during the debate, not making any clear points.
meanings.sent3: The comedian wabblers on stage, trying to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The teacher wabblers during the lecture, losing the students' attention.
meanings.sent5: The radio host wabblers on the show, sharing random stories with listeners.
